_description: Stewart, ‘The Variance of Court’ — ten 5-line stanzas aabab, including refrain phrase ‘gud seruys’

CULLl510.First Lines:
Rolling In my rememberaunceOff court þe daylie
                    variance…
CULLl510.Last Lines:
…And pay ilk man þair condigne wageAccording to þair
                    ruid service

CamMagPep2553.First Lines:
Rolling In my RememberanceOff court þe daylie
                    variance…
CamMagPep2553.Last Lines:
…And pay ilk man þair condigne wageAccording to þair
                    gud Seruys
CamMagPep2553.Editions:
Craigie,  William Alexander. 
             The Maitland Folio Manuscript, Containing Poems by Sir Richard
                Maitland, Dunbar, Douglas, Henryson, and others.
             2 vols. 
             Scottish Text Society
         n.s. 7 (1919), 20 (1927); Edinburgh and London: Blackwood, 1919,
            1927: 1.370-2.

Banna.First Lines:
Rolling in my remembranceof court the daylie
                    variance…
Banna.Last Lines:
…And pay ilk man thair conding wegeAccording to their gud
                    seruyiss
